page.title: 02Interview with Mrs. Lawson
page.content: Mrs Lawson was born on the Eyhurst estate and has lived in this area for 70 years. Eyhurst estate in Chipstead had 1 doctor,a post office and a sweet shop. A horse and cart came around with provisions. The roads were only made of gravel and were very rough. People had to walk wherever they wanted to go. The only good road was from Chipstead Station to Reigate Hill. Mrs Lawson attended a school with only one classroom and children from 5 to 14 had lessons together. The railway from Tattenham corner to Chipstead was built during her childhood. The railway banks were clear then but are now overgrown. The people were very poor and at Christmas the church gave red cloaks to the poor to keep them warm. Most children attended Sunday school. Life was very simple before the second world war.
